abstract: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, United Nations high commissioner for human rights, plans special three-day trip to Central African Republic to review human rights abuse prevention efforts and ensure swift response to such offenses; is accused of mishandling allegations that French peacekeeping forces sexually abused Central African Republic children in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, the United Nations’ top human rights official, is to meet with the new acting leader of the peacekeeping mission, which has been roiled by sexual abuse allegations.

headline.main: U.N. Official to Visit Central African Republic Amid Scrutiny Over Peacekeepers
headline.print_headline: U.N. Rights Chief to Visit Central African Republic

snippet: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, the United Nations’ top human rights official, is to meet with the new acting leader of the peacekeeping mission, which has been roiled by sexual abuse allegations.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
